title: [ADULT DISCUSSION] Why is it socially acceptable to be racist towards White people?
body:
By normalizing racism against one race of people, are we not just perpetuating the problem that we're trying to solve?

I know some people say "It helps raise awareness of racism as an issue!" But there are far better ways to do so. "It helps build discussion!" I mean, sure, but a lot of people _aren't_ using this as a way to build discussion. They're using it as a way to spread hate, and isn't this what every minority group dislikes about racism? Using it as a means to spread hate against someone else?

Hypocrisy isn't the way to equality.

"White people" memes are popular, and they're also racist, and you can bet that people making "Black people" or "Hispanic people" memes are getting flak for it. Why is this behaviour not frowned upon? Why is turning the anti-racism movement on its head and being racist towards different groups of people seen as OK?

You _can_ be racist towards White people, by the way. I know a lot of people say that the definition of racism has changed (it hasn't) to mean that the only race you can't be racist to is the White one "because they're never been oppressed before by non-Whites" but that's simply not true, as Whites were the original slave race and were sold as slaves in Africa.

So let's discuss: Why is it deemed socially acceptable to be racist towards White people, and do you think this helps or hinders the anti-racism campaign?
